interesting_fact: Australia is home to the world's longest fence, known as the Dingo Fence, which stretches over 5,600 kilometers.
Japan has over 6,800 islands, with the five largest being Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, Shikoku, and Okinawa.
The Amazon Rainforest, located primarily in Brazil, is so large that it produces more than 20% of the world’s oxygen.
Russia is the largest country in the world, covering over 17 million square kilometers, which is about 11% of Earth's land area.
India is home to the world's second-largest population and has more than 2,000 distinct ethnic groups.
Egypt's Great Pyramid of Giza is the only surviving structure of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, measuring over 202,080 kilometers.
China is home to the world's largest population and has over 300 cities with more than a million residents.
South Africa is known as the 'Rainbow Nation' due to its diverse cultures and 11 official languages.
Argentina is home to the Andes, the longest continental mountain range in the world, stretching over 7,000 kilometers.
